plugins.name: Retextifier
plugins.description: Change multiple texts in a batch, without having to click on each of them first. Paste new-line delimited texts into the several layers at once.How the plugin works:â€¢ Plugin will find every visible, unlocked text layer, and show you the input for each of them, letting you change all the texts in one take.â€¢ Plugin is aware of text layer positions and nesting layers, and ordering inputs depending on layer positions from top left to bottom right.â€¢ Completely keyboard accessible â€” select next field with TAB, change texts with ENTER, cancel with ESCHow to use:1. Select all the layers you want to be changed. If there is a Group or Frame within the selection, the plugin will find every unlocked visible text layer inside the selection.2. Call the plugin and change texts in the needed layers. Navigate between fields with Tab / Shift+Tab.You also can paste multiple lines at once. Hold Shift while pasting, and every new line from copied text will be pasted into its own field.Â Copying with Shift will copy texts from currently selected input and all inputs down from it will be copied to clipboard with new lines as delimiters. (It is handy to past the set of text in another group of layers using Retextifier)3. Click "Change" or press Enter. All changes would be applied. Mixed formatting for the layers that have been changed will be dropped.See some details and video preview on Twitter: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1179063309280174081Also, follow me there to not miss new updates and announcements.Added in version 4:â€¢ Text layer corresponding with the currently active input now selected on canvas, so you can see more clearly which layer you will be changing.â€¢ Input orders now depend on position and nesting of the layers. If the top leftmost object among the selected is a group or a frame, all the text layers inside it will be placed in the list of inputs first, and so on.â€¢ Now you can copy multiple layers from inputs. When you press Cmd+Shift+C texts from the currently selected input and all inputs down from it will be copied to clipboard with new lines as delimiters.â€¢ Now tabs also work as delimiters with multiline paste. With that, you can copy-paste rows from Google Sheets and other places.Added in version 10:â€¢ Now the plugin finally works correctly on Windows! Had to implement some tricky logic handling new lines on Windows, and now everything should work as expected.â€¢ Starting from this version, the plugin preserves the name of the layer when changing the text. This will ensure that changing the texts won't disrupt smart animate or propagating defaults from main components into instances. Whenever you need to match layer name back to the text content, you could use â€œReset Text Layer Nameâ€ plugin.Added in version 13:â€¢ Since recently, Figma no longer allows developers the access to paste events from the code, which means that I can no longer assign a custom shortcut for the multipaste feature.â€¢ Therefore, in this version, instead of a shortcut, there will be a multiline paste checkbox. The regular paste shortcut will now act as multipaste, meaning that every new row in your clipboard will be pasted into its own field in the plugin. Checkbox is on by default, but you can also uncheck the checkbox and paste into each field individually.â€¢ This somewhat worsens the experience, but it is the only thing I can do for now to make plugin work. I will keep looking for a solution in the meantime and will update it if Figma allows plugin developers to work with the clipboard directly.

accepted.name: Vadim Pleshkov
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: Change several text layers in one go

120977.release_notes:
â€¢ Since recently, Figma no longer allows developers the access to paste events from the code, which means that I can no longer assign a custom shortcut for the multipaste feature. 
â€¢ Therefore, in this version, instead of a shortcut, there will be a multiline paste checkbox. The regular paste shortcut will now act as multipaste, meaning that every new row in your clipboard will be pasted into its own field in the plugin. Checkbox is on by default, but you can also uncheck the checkbox and paste into each field individually.
â€¢ This somewhat worsens the experience, but it is the only thing I can quickly do for now to make plugin work for now. I will keep looking for a solution and will update it if Figma allows plugin developers to work with the clipboard directly.

Please let me know if there is any issues with the plugin in the meanwhile.

plugins.name: PDF Export with TEXT and VECTOR objects
plugins.description: MKitFPdf allows you to easily export all or selected frames as PDF, You can edit the order before exporting.The output differs from others mainly in that all texts as selectable and copyable text taken into the PDF.Thus, the size of the generated PDF can be greatly minimized.The generation takes place completely on your end device, none of your data is transferred to an external server, thus your data remains with you.We had to stop the free use of the plugin.Two versions are now available:Free version: contains 5 PDF exports per month.Paid version: Unlimited PDF export for 1, 6 or 12 monthsÂ FeaturesText is exported as TEXTVector Objects as PathSupport Layout GridsSupport for owner fontsadd Figma comments to the PDFMinimum size of the generated pdfYour data remains with youAllows you to output tables of contents (Outlines) in pdf formatAllows the specification of PDF boxes (Trimbox, BleedBox,Mediabox)Allows the specification of meta data such as Title, Author ...Current restrictions:No effects like "drop shadow" are supportedRequest a feature, report a defect or troubleshootFor any bug reports and support, please look at ourÂ issue tracker
plugins.tagline: Text and vector objects are retained, compresses the file size. Search engines can read the text!

plugins.name: Safely Delete Components
plugins.description:
When you delete a component, it can be still used in your mockups. On the other hand, unused components clutter up your document.

Safely Delete Components does two things:

ğŸ—‘  Safe Delete

1. Select a component you want to delete
2. Go to Plugins > Safely Delete Components > Safe Delete (or âŒ˜+/ > "Safe Delete")
3. This component will be deleted if there are no instances of it in the document

ğŸ§¹  Delete Unused Components

1. Go to Plugins > Safely Delete Components > Delete Unused Components (or âŒ˜+/ > "Delete Unused Components")
2. The plugin will find components with no instances and delete them

When the plugin finishes its work, you'll see which components have been deleted.

Be aware that this plugin can be very slow with large documents, especially when working with unused components.

plugins.name: Typography Style Guide Generator
plugins.description: This plugin allows you to generate a typography style guide based on your defined local styles.The generator is especially built for teams who work according to the Tailwind Design system and use the associated naming scheme (e.g., "Heading / L / Regular").Styles will be grouped based on the prefix before the slash and sorted by font size. Relevant font information like family, size, line height, and others will be shown per style. If there is no prefix, then the styles will be added to a group called "Other".There are three options when running the plugin:Create a style guide with all defined local text styles.Create a style guide with all defined local text styles and add a tag if the style is used on the currently open page. This is especially useful if you have a large design system and thus not all styles are relevant for a subproject, but you still want to show the whole set.Create a style guide with only the used local text styles on the current page.Enjoy and looking forward to your feedback.

accepted.name: novu
accepted.description: Web and Software Agency from Basel, Bern, and Zurich

plugins.tagline: Automatically generate text style guides based on your defined local text styles.

plugins.name: axe for Designers: A Free Accessibility Plugin
plugins.description: axe for Designers: A Free Accessibility PluginAre you exhausted from dealing with endless back and forth with developers, messy handouts, and accessibility issues in your designs? Introducing axe for Designers, a Figma accessibility plugin supported by AI/ML, developed by Deque, a market leader in digital accessibility.With features like A11y Scan (previously auto scan), wcag Color Contrast Checker, Focus Order, Annotations, and more, you can quickly and easily identify any accessibility issues before your design goes into production. And if you're already in the middle of a project, our tool can help you analyze and fix accessibility issues that have cropped up.Best of all, you can use our Figma accessibility plugin for free!!Introducing axe for Designers' featuresEnsure your designs meet WCAG compliance standards with a single click. Make design-to-dev handoffs more effective by seamlessly bridging the gap between design and development with the axe for Designers. Consider integrating this website accessibility plugin to ensure all users can access your content effortlessly.Annotations: Communicate your design intent effectively to developers by adding explicit accessibility annotations. Refine your design intent effortlessly with the axe for Designers' Edit Annotation feature, ensuring precise communication and reducing rework. Tags for developers facilitate smoother handoffs.â€¢ Extensive Annotation Stamps: Access a comprehensive set of annotation stamps, including automated developer tags, with short recommendations and detailed documentation for developers.â€¢ AI/ML Driven Auto-annotations: Explore the auto-annotation feature, which automatically scans and annotates form controls like buttons, radio buttons, checkboxes, and labels.Automated Accessibility Scan:Receive real-time suggestions for design improvements for color contrast, text readability, and more, making your designs inclusive for all users.Color Contrast Checker:Looking for a WCAG color contrast checker? Easily assess contrast ratios and ensure your designs adhere to AA or AAA requirements. Explore accessible color palettes to enhance your design's inclusivity.Touch Targets Size:Confirm that touch targets in your designs are user-friendly and accessible to everyone.Inappropriate or Missing Headings Hierarchies:Run checks on your designs to ensure heading hierarchies are appropriately structured for accessibility.Focus Order:Optimize user navigation and enhance accessibility in your designs with the axe for Designers' Focus Order feature, ensuring a seamless experience for all.Dashboard View:Save and share reports seamlessly. Access your dashboard directly from the plugin or log in to dashboard to view reports, product documentation, and other accessible design resources.Users Testimonials:â€œThis plugin is the best thing to happen to Figma. It's awesome! I've been using Axe for over 5 years now and it's so great to be able to get even a fraction of that suite inside of Figma. Keep up the great work!â€- Bryce Watson, Head of Design, Yoke"Thank you so much for making this! I was used to baking in accessibility annotations as part of a design system, but this is a more powerful way to annotate for accessibility. The plugin explains more about each "type" of annotation, enabling designers to learn more as they work and facilitating more productive conversations between designers and engineers."- Sarah Bonville, Senior Product Designer, Accessibility. Khan Academyâ€œMy experience with the Axe for Designers plugin has been great. It helps designers quickly check and annotate designs, allowing for more accurate accessibility details earlier in the design and development processes.â€- Adam Wertel UI/UX Lead, SpreedlyLearn more !
plugins.tagline: Your one-stop accessibility solution!

plugins.name: Text Styles Creator
plugins.description: Text Style Creator is a handy Figma plugin that automates the process of creating text styles from your text layers.Usage:Select your text layer(s).Run the plugin.The plugin will create a new text style for each unique set of text properties.Features:Creates new text styles based on the properties of your selected text layers and immediately applies them.Avoids duplicating styles with the same properties, even across different text contents.Notifies you if no layers are selected, how many new styles have been created, how many existing styles were skipped, and applies the created styles to the selected text.Feature Updates:Bulk Selection Support: Enhanced to support bulk selection, ensuring when multiple text layers with the same properties are selected, only one unique style is created, reducing redundancy and clutter.Automatic Style Application: Added functionality to automatically apply the created text style to the selected text layers, streamlining your workflow.Efficient Style Management: Continues to prevent the creation of new styles for layers that already match an existing style, maintaining a tidy style library.Please note: This plugin only works with text layers and uses the text content as the style name. It's designed to be a simple, run-once tool to help streamline your design workflow in Figma.Kishor on Dribbble and InstagramPlease give Text Style Creator a try and see if it suits your needs. Looking forward to your valuable feedback!
plugins.tagline: Automate text style creation and management in Figma for a smoother design workflow.

Be confident every design you hand-off is 100% consistent with your Style Guide or Design System.Â How to use Roller:1 - Import or add your styles to the Roller Library2 - Roller then automatically finds any inconsistencies (Errors) on the page that donâ€™t match what is in your Library3 - Replace the Error with one of your Libraryâ€™s styles4 - Rinse & repeat to reach 100% consistencyÂ Lint in the following categories:â€¢ Colors - Quickly fix the 50 (or 5,000) shades of gray that are lurking in your designs.Â â€¢ Text - If a subtle line-height or letter-spacing is off, Roller will pick them up and get you back on system.Â â€¢ Borders - Roller lets you add the width and colors of your borders - making it easy to find any rogue input field or card.Â â€¢ Shadows - Roller gives you superhuman eyes - making it possible to detect subtle differences in shadow blurs or x, y offsets.Â â€¢ Radiuses - Be confident that any button, card, input etc. has the correct border-radiuses applied.Â Keep your team in-sync:Roller lets you store and share your Library with teammates. Make sure everyone on your team has up-to-date resources and styles when linting.

plugins.name: Accessible color palettes
plugins.description: This is a tool to generate a dynamic, accessibility-first color palette for your design systems within Figma.Using key colors, you can target specific contrast ratios against a chosen background color and color space. These constraints will generate a color palette based on that key color. You can choose to test and find out more information, or set the color styles for your file based on these results.If you'd like a video walkthrough on how I use this tool, you can see that here on my Youtube Channel.This tool leverages the work done by Nate Baldwin on LeonardoColor.io, an open source color tool, to bring similar functionality into generating test palettes, and updating styles in your system. Thus allowing you to check your work with more data from their tool.If you have any questions, you can reach out to me on Twitter at @darianrosebrook

accepted.name: Darian Rosebrook
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.name: Sizze - Figma to Native powered by AI
plugins.description: Our Figma plugin effortlessly bridges the gap between design and development by transforming your Figma designs into ready-to-use components within the Sizze library. This tool is designed to streamline workflows and enhance productivity for both designers and developers, offering several key features:- Functional and Visual Adaptability: It ensures that the components are both visually appealing and functionally robust, allowing for a high degree of customization.- Broad React Compatibility: The plugin supports seamless integration with any React-based application, including React Native, making it versatile for both web and mobile development projects.- Ionic and Capacitor Integration: For teams working on hybrid mobile applications, the plugin's compatibility with Ionic and Capacitor is a significant advantage.- Native Design Compliance: It adheres to the design guidelines of iOS and Android, ensuring that the apps maintain a native look and feel on both platforms.- Customizable Themes: With support for global styles for dark and light themes, the plugin allows for easy theme customization across projects or specific components.This Figma plugin is an essential tool for teams aiming to accelerate their app development process while ensuring consistency and compatibility across platforms.

accepted.description: Convert design to app with ease

plugins.name: Above The Fold
plugins.description: Make sure your most important elements will be visible every time on every device. Above the Fold plugin marks your designs with a layer that indicates where the above-the-fold portion ends.ğŸ”ŒHow Above the Fold plugin works?- Select one (or more) Artboard(s).- Run the plugin with your desired target device.- Your results * are ready* The results are seperate layers on top of each Artboard.â“ How can Above the Fold help me?Above the Fold is the portion of a Web page that is visible in a browser window when the page first loads. Users engage more with the content above the fold than below the fold, thus key site functions and content related to business goals should appear at the top of the Web page.ğŸš¨ What is the Danger zone?The viewport is the area where browsers load the web pages and >90% * is different than the user's screen resolution. The browser and OS navigation bars add a dynamic offset to the final viewport. The danger zone represent the average difference in height between screen resolution and viewport.*They are equal only when the web browser is in fullscreen mode

plugins.name: Lokalise
plugins.description: What is Lokalise?All-in-one localization and translation management platform that allows developers, designers, translators, and product managers to work seamlessly together and deliver digital products into multiple international markets faster and in a more efficient manner.How does Figma + Lokalise work?Lokalise enables you to design a product or a website for a global audience right away. Use the Figma plugin to quickly include translated content in your designs without going back and forth with product managers, translators and developers.This Figma plugin allows you to:- Push texts from Figma to Lokalise- Set key names (unique identifiers that are used for representing text in code and your design) or use any of the patterns for automatic naming- Match Figma texts to existing Lokalise keys (and existing translations)- Pull translated texts from Lokalise to Figma- Seamlessly switch languages in Figma and check if your design works in other languagesLaunch the plugin1. Open your Figma project2. Go to the Plugins section and choose Lokalise3. Connect your Lokalise account4. Allow Figma to access your Lokalise workspace.5. Go back to Figma and select one of the existing Lokalise projects or create a new one. You can also set the default key naming pattern and the default platform for the newly created keys (this applies to the keys this Figma plugin will create in Lokalise).6. Click Finish Setup.When the setup is complete. Start using the plugin by pushing your Figma strings to the Lokalise project so translators can start working on them right away.For more information (with screenshots) check out the detailed documentation pagehttps://docs.lokalise.com/en/articles/3732824-figmaThis plugin requires a paid Lokalise account (14-day free trial).

plugins.name: Coda for Figma
plugins.description: Design with data from apps like Spotify, Wikipedia or your own custom data with this plugin. This plugin works with Coda, a tool for making documents. Simply create a table in Coda, and use the plugin to fill your designs with content from the tables.â†’ To use this plugin1. Create a Coda doc with a table in it, or use the example doc that's provided. The example doc already has data for you to get started with.2. Fill individual layers by selecting the layer you want to change, and then select the relevant column in the plugin selector.3. Group layers, or create a component, to keep related info together.4. Select an entire frame or multiple groups to update all of the layers at once.â†’ Live DataTo pull live data into your Figma designs, create a Packs Table in Coda. Using Packs you can pull in data from Wikipedia, Spotify, Intercom and more. Once you've set up your table, you can connect your design to that table and watch it fill up with real data.â†’ Custom DataTo pull custom data into your Figma docs, create a Table in Coda. You can enter text, image URLs, formulas, and more. Then, connect your layers to that table, and watch your designs fill up with your own data.See more info here: https://coda.io/d/Example-data-doc_dFOHtXx4pnz

accepted.name: Helena Jaramillo
accepted.description: Here for softer technology / Design @ Coda.

19549.release_notes:
* fixed images not loading reliably, now loading faster
* fixed various issues with autolayout layers
* you can now apply data to component instances and masters
* you can now populate hyperlinks with data from coda. if a textlayer has a hyperlink, data applied to the layer will replace the url of the hyperlink

plugins.name: ItemFlow
plugins.description: Visually connect 2 figma elements. Made with workflow speed and performance in mind.PurposeIt solves a need to see how items are related to each other by visually connecting them. Original purpose is to design complex systems and their architecture.TerminologyItem - is any figma element (text, frame, group, image)Flow - is a line that goes from item -> to itemHowÂ toÂ useCreate/Update flow - select the first and the second items by holding shift.Delete flow - set 'lock' switch to disabled state, select flow directly and delete it by pressing [Delete].Get static flow - select flows you need, group them by pressing [Ctrl + G] and move outside the 'ItemFlow' groupInterfaceÂ guideÂ isÂ in theÂ cover art or on imgurTechnicalÂ stuffThe more flows you got, the less frequent plugin will update them in order to save you fps.ThereÂ areÂ many pluginsÂ likeÂ that, whyÂ amÂ iÂ copying their ideas?(UXÂ opinionÂ fromÂ septemberÂ 2021)Â IÂ triedÂ manyÂ freeÂ pluginsÂ toÂ createÂ flowsÂ andÂ allÂ ofÂ themÂ hadÂ greatÂ implementationsÂ ofÂ howÂ itÂ shouldÂ be,Â but theyÂ also gotÂ weakÂ sidesÂ toÂ doÂ architectureÂ stuff.Get the source code and/or contributeÂ GithubBecause its free, i feel in power to advertise our group :)WeÂ areÂ designingÂ mmorpgÂ andÂ lookingÂ forÂ enthusiasts
